page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: The survey block is dominated by farmland. The smallest farms in the area are about 75-125 acres. They are really large smallholdings,worked just by the families that own them. All farms are {freeholds.}Only one farm has been taken over by a financial institution. The largest farms are about 1000 acres: Shepherds' Farm, Ashwell and the Farr's farm, Newnham. There are 4/5 farms in the middle range. The main{cash crops}are winter wheat and barley. Some grow peas to break the rotation. The bigger farms also give a small acreage to{soft fruit {like raspberries and}strawberries. These are picked by casual labour from Ashwell or sold on a "Pick-Your-Own" basis. Farrows Farm, Ashwell also has a herd of some 3000 fat pigs.
